First Party Collection/Use: We collect information in a few different ways, such as when you give it to us or give us permission to obtain it.
When you use Pinterest, you voluntarily share certain information.
We use your information to provide and improve your experience, including to identify you when you use our Services.
Third Party Sharing/Collection: We also receive information about you and your activity outside Pinterest from our affiliates, advertisers, partners and other third parties we work with.
We share data for advertising and related purposes, including showing you ads about Pinterest on third-party services.
User Access/Edit/Deletion: You can request access to the information we collect and hold about you in a portable format.
You can correct your information by updating information in your profile.
You can have your information deleted by selecting 'Delete your data and account' in your settings.
Data Retention: We keep your information only so long as we need it to provide Pinterest to you and fulfill the purposes described in this policy.
If you live in the EEA, the UK, or Switzerland, we keep your information only so long as necessary for the purposes identified in this Privacy Policy.
Data Security: We may access user information in relation to a legal claim, litigation, or regulatory proceeding.
We analyze users’ log data and device information to identify and investigate suspicious behavior or violations of our policies.
International/Specific Audiences: For the purposes of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), if you are a resident in the EEA, Switzerland, and UK, Pinterest Europe Ltd. and Pinterest, Inc. are joint data controllers of your personal data.
Children under 13 are not allowed to use Pinterest.
Do Not Track: For users who reside in certain U.S. states and have enabled an opt-out preferences signal (such as Global Privacy Control), we will respect this preference when you use Pinterest.
Policy Change: We may change this policy from time to time and if we do, we’ll post any changes on this page.
If the changes are significant, we may provide a more prominent notice, such as by sending you an email.
User Choice/Control: You can control how we use this information to personalize your experience and the ads you see on Pinterest in your Privacy and Data Settings.
Where we rely on consent, you can withdraw that consent at any time.
Introductory/Generic: We wrote this policy to help you understand what information we collect, how we use it and what choices you have about it.
Privacy contact information: The best way to get in touch with us or to exercise your options described above is through the Help Center.
If you live in the United States, Pinterest, Inc. is responsible for your information.
